intro: Edraianthus kitaibelii subsp. croaticus, commonly known as the Croatian edraianthus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
